content: simple collar crochet pattern by sophia orquiz level easy supplies hook size k-101/2 6 50 mm or larger for this pattern i used a m-13 9 0 mm crochet hook bulky weight 5 yarn 1 skein for this pattern i used a 98% acrylic/2% polyester mix tapestry needle stitch markers to mark the end of your row scissors *when selecting your materials you may want to consider whether they can be washed or not terminology st stitch sts stitches slp st slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet for this pattern you will need to know how to slip_stitch and create a chain the pattern consists of the single_crochet stitch half_double_crochet stitch double_crochet stitch and turning chains note this pattern will be worked in row row 1 create a foundation chain begin with a slip knot leave a long tail for tying your collar at the end of your completed project chain 56 then chain 1 turn *this is your turning chain row 2 1 double_crochet crochet in the second stitch from hook repeat 56 sts ch1 turn row 3-4 1 double_crochet crochet in each st 56 sts ch1 turn row 5 bottom trim 1 half_double_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 half_double_crochet in the first st then 1 half_double_crochet only in the next st repeat 26 times then 1 half_double_crochet 1 double_crochet 1 half_double_crochet in the last st edging 1 single_crochet in next 4 spaces up the side of the collar 2 single_crochet sts in the first top corner stitch of the collar crochet over the tail but leave it hanging out of the corner for tying 1 single_crochet in each st across the top then 2 single_crochet sts in last top corner stitch of the collar 1 single_crochet in next 4 spaces down the side of the collar 1 slp st in the next 2 sts cut make sure to leave a really long tail pull yarn through now sew your tail back up the side of the collar to the top corner with a tapestry needle tie both your tails into a bow and then trim both ends so it is even if you prefer you can add a button to the collar or use scarf pin to hold it together final dimensions/measurements the collar should be at least 22-23 inches long when it is laid flat and open and about 3-4 inches wide/high depending on gauge and hook size you can adjust the length to your liking by adding or removing chains and/or changing hook size you can adjust the width/height by adding more row or less row just be sure to end your chain on an even number so your row and bottom trim evens out please note you may sell finished product you may not post share or sell this
